docs.lead_paragraph: This week, answers to readers' questions about whether you should ignore someone you almost cheated with, your neighbor's pot habit and other issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: This week ends with news headlines and personalities that send us right back to the 2008 campaign. Sarah Palin. Abortion. Steve Schmidt. Gay Marriage. Campaign finance reports.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is the universal sign of a new idea going mainstream: Oprah Winfrey is bestowing her endorsement on Twitter.
docs.abstract: Twitter is getting the ultimate endorsement: Oprah Winfrey has joined Twitter and will devote her Friday show to the microblogging service.
docs.snippet: Twitter is getting the ultimate endorsement: Oprah Winfrey has joined Twitter and will devote her Friday show to the microblogging service.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York Times reporter Jane Brody's recent article on avoiding the health hazards of air travel, "Flying Healthy, From Takeoff Past Landing," sparked a lot of interest, and some questions, from readers.

headline.main: Travel Health: Jet Lag, Cosmic Radiation and In-Flight Emergencies

docs.abstract: Mark Gendreau, M.D., answers reader questions on safe air travel.
docs.snippet: Mark Gendreau, M.D., answers reader questions on safe air travel.

docs.lead_paragraph: Children of women who took valproate during pregnancy scored lower on I.Q. tests than similar children not exposed to the drug, researchers found.

headline.main: I.Q. Harmed by Epilepsy Drug in Utero
headline.print_headline: Study Ties Lower I.Q. to Drug Used by Pregnant Women

docs.snippet: Children of women who took valproate during pregnancy scored lower on I.Q. tests than similar children not exposed to the drug, researchers found.
